Package danogl.components.movement_schemes

package danogl.components.movement_schemes
The public classes in the package are components that can be added to GameObjects in order to control their movement/direction according to various popular schemes. The MovementSchemes are suited to either player-driven avatars, AI agents, or any other GameObject which should move according to some conditions in user-input or in the world.
Note that objects with predictable and repeating movement, such as a platform moving regularly in a fixed pattern, might be better served by the Transition component instead of a MovementScheme.
Author:
Dan Nirel
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    danogl.components
    A few useful components that can be added to a GameObject
    danogl.components.movement_schemes.movement_directing
    The focus of this package is the MovementDirector class.
  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    DirectionalMovementScheme
    MovementScheme that allows the GameObject to move sideways, up, down, or in any of the diagonals.
    DragMovementScheme
    MovementScheme for "dragging" an object, i.e.
    MovementScheme
    Note than this is only an abstract superclass for concrete MovementSchemes.
    PlatformerMovementScheme
    MovementScheme that allows a GameObject to move sideways, and jump if it isn't already jumping.
    RailMovementScheme
    MovementScheme that allows the GameObject to move sideways.
    SteeringMovementScheme
    MovementScheme that allows the GameObject to turn (rotate) left and right, and move forwards or backwards.
    TargetMovementScheme
    The GameObject will move towards a supplied (movable) target location, when a given predicate holds.
